task: Analyze the distribution of numerical features
method: Use histograms and box plots to visualize the distribution of numerical features such as Age, Fare, etc.
Calculate summary statistics (mean, median, standard deviation, etc.) for these features.

task: Analyze the distribution of categorical features
method: Use bar plots to visualize the distribution of categorical features such as Pclass, Sex, Embarked, etc.
Calculate the frequency and proportion of each category.
Use scatter plots and pair plots to explore relationships between numerical features.
Use cross-tabulations and heatmaps to examine relationships between categorical features and between categorical and numerical features.

task: Analyze the target variable (Survived) in relation to other features
method: Use bar plots and box plots to visualize the relationship between the target variable and other features.
Calculate survival rates for different categories of categorical features.
Use box plots and z-scores to identify outliers in numerical features.
Investigate the impact of outliers on the overall data distribution and consider potential reasons for their presence.
Create a detailed report summarizing the findings from the in-depth EDA.
Include visualizations, summary statistics, and key insights that will inform the next steps.
